result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

02:47 PM   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not Guilty Plea entered by the Court. Defendant requests Jury Trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.. $650 Cash bond posted and continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). $650 Cash bond on deposit. rb
